title: [Bug] humanDelay not applied to WhatsApp block streaming replies
body:
## Description
`humanDelay` (configured as `custom` with `minMs: 2000, maxMs: 4500`) does not appear to apply delays between block streaming replies on WhatsApp. Blocks are sent with inconsistent timing that correlates with model generation time, not the configured delay range.

## Config
```json
{
  "agents": {
    "defaults": {
      "blockStreamingDefault": "on",
      "blockStreamingBreak": "text_end",
      "blockStreamingChunk": {
        "minChars": 100,
        "maxChars": 400,
        "breakPreference": "paragraph"
      },
      "humanDelay": {
        "mode": "custom",
        "minMs": 2000,
        "maxMs": 4500
      }
    }
  },
  "channels": {
    "whatsapp": {
      "blockStreaming": true,
      "chunkMode": "newline",
      "textChunkLimit": 1000
    }
  }
}
```

## Evidence (from gateway logs)
WhatsApp block reply timestamps:
```
07:26:16.588 - block 1
07:26:26.064 - block 2 (+9.5s)
07:26:42.268 - block 3 (+16.2s)
07:26:45.906 - block 4 (+3.6s)
```

Expected: Gaps between blocks should be consistently within 2000-4500ms.
Actual: Gaps vary from 3.6s to 16.2s, suggesting delays are model generation time, not humanDelay.

## Comparison: iMessage works
For reference, iMessage block streaming in the same session shows consistent ~2.7s gaps (within the humanDelay range):
```
04:41:28.551 - block 1
04:41:31.229 - block 2 (+2.7s)
04:41:33.892 - block 3 (+2.7s)
04:41:36.553 - block 4 (+2.7s)
```

## Environment
- Clawdbot: v2026.1.24-3
- Channel: WhatsApp (selfChatMode)
- Model: anthropic/claude-opus-4-5
- OS: macOS (Darwin 25.1.0, arm64)

## Expected Behavior
Block streaming replies on WhatsApp should have consistent delays between blocks within the configured humanDelay range (2000-4500ms), similar to iMessage behavior.
